channel.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
channel.description:
http://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Jagex-Reviews-E322592.htm
What those reviews highlight, essentially, is an almost toxic workplace culture. I'm willing to bet that they have a few years in them at best. Discuss.

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @noah1gamble noah1gamble
item.description:
@noah1gamble wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:23, topic:494683”][quote author=l link=topic=612915.msg4263343#msg4263343 date=1363666814]
Bleh, RS is falling anyways
[/quote]
Yep, that’s why they have 145k players on daily.[/quote]
Cough 60k Cough

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

I thought this was only for contract workers though?

Also, found this:

http://news.cnet.com/more-overtime-tussles-for-tech-companies/2100-1022_3-5709595.html

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:32, topic:494683”][quote author=Cruel Truth link=topic=612915.msg4264205#msg4264205 date=1363810449]

[quote author=Ambokile link=topic=612915.msg4263759#msg4263759 date=1363731225]

Unpaid overtime is expected, this is apparently industry standard but not exactly nice.Recently (last few weeks) shifted to mandatory overtime for several teams. This makes the unpaid aspect to the overtime downright unpleasant.

I highly doubt they aren’t paid for overtime nor would I believe something like that without valid proof to be totally honest. I do live in America though so maybe the UK laws on that is different?[/quote]

It’s not uncommon in the IT industry. If there’s a release date, and you won’t reach that date in worktime, you work late.

This.
Read other reviews of other game companies, if you’re coming on the deadline of a game and it’s not where it’s supposed to be, you’ll be there till it’s done.
Rockstar is mentioned as a sweatshop for doing this too.

It’s not even solely game companies - any company (usually those in the computer industry although I’m sure other industries such as film etc) that has publicised deadlines will not miss them
[/quote]I know what you guys are saying but I find it hard to believe that overtime pay wasn’t given is what I am saying.

I work in manufacturing. I get the occasional overtime when a large order comes due so I know it can be rough out there trying to meet certain deadlines. I have NEVER worked overtime without getting paid extra for it. Even though, the factory I work at is part of the government so maybe that’s why :o

And we’re saying that in the tech industry, unpaid overtime is common lol.[/quote]
100% True, in the UK at least.

Read full topic

I work in manufacturing. I get the occasional overtime when a large order comes due so I know it can be rough out there trying to meet certain deadlines. I have NEVER worked overtime without getting paid extra for it. Even though, the factory I work at is part of the government so maybe that’s why :o[/quote]

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

This makes me sad. Jagex have f’ed up a lot lately but you can tell they are trying. The review does sound like it’s true because it would make sense from my understanding what the flaws are in the game.

The game defonetly needs a lead designer or w.e. it’s called who understands the vibe Rs had up until late 2012. It did loose some of its vibe in 2010- early 2012 but it was still good.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

Unpaid overtime is expected, this is apparently industry standard but not exactly nice.Recently (last few weeks) shifted to mandatory overtime for several teams. This makes the unpaid aspect to the overtime downright unpleasant.

I highly doubt they aren’t paid for overtime nor would I believe something like that without valid proof to be totally honest. I do live in America though so maybe the UK laws on that is different?

Limited promotion prospects; management and exec roles are mostly external hires.

Reality…100% of all higher level jobs are going to be like that. I will give you an example. You may be able to reach a production supervisor/manager position, but the plant manager will 99% of the time be an external hire.

History of unsuccessful attempts to branch out from the core game, each repeating some trends that could have been addressed, e.g. shifting direction frequently on key mechanics and ignoring early warning signs, such as testers and developers on the project admitting "This game isn't fun" and multiple changes in creative leads for the same product.

Again, common in any industry. Policies try to change, different procedures are created. Are they followed to the dot? There is just a gap in paperwork and efficiency when an audit occurs when there is any type of change.

Communication between teams is often lacking, resulting in unnecessary, premature or wasted work. Middle Management get panicky near milestones, resulting in sudden micromanagement and slightly raised tempers, but often appear disinterested (late for meetings discussing the project, slow to respond to questions) in the intervening periods.

Again, very common. Very few companies have good “communication”. To be fair though, I can see where communication would be a key factor in a gaming industry.

No granularity on importance of decisions, every request is "critical" and "top priority" which has to be done "ASAP". Decisions may be later overruled subject to another manager or executive's whim.

This one made me laugh. I want to see proof of this one as well. Every item put on the table as a suggestion for any type of business will have a priority level. For example, do you buy new machinery for the factory works, or get that expensive ice machine dispenser that the employees have been desperately been wanting? It all comes down to money.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Its because when Andrew was running the company he actually knew what he wanted to accomplish with runescape and of course gave employees more benefits. I am sure the few guys at fenresearch are making more money than any of the guys at Jagex.

The worse thing Andrew did was bring that new lead of runescape in who had no idea what runescape was. Tbh, he should of handed the position to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hu5sqhlgBno the man of the right instead of MMG or whatever the fk his name is.

How could you do that? Hey, I am looking for someone to run world of warcraft, I feel like backing off management and want to worry about development… have you ever played? Nope. Well the position is yours! wtf cmon

Also if you care so much about their pay… the average pay is around 40k euros a year.

Read full topic

It could also easily fail too, doesn’t look like something I would play.

I’m wondering what happened to MechScape/Stellar Dawn. That had something going for it. Have they just dropped it?

EDIT: http://services.stellardawn.com/m=forum_fo/forums.ws?83,84,14,119886 Figures as much.

item.source: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too

item.title: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:10, topic:494683”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=612915.msg4238256#msg4238256 date=1361681778]

I looked at this about a year ago and it was extremely different. All of the salaries were 3-4x what they are now and the ratings were much, much higher. Seems as though they’re in a landslide.

I don’t think their salaries have ever been that high, to be honest. I’ve looked at their job postings over the years (I wanted to work there when I was in early high school - ha) and they’re more or less the same.
If Britain’s cost of living is the same as, or higher than, Australia’s then their jobs would barely cover living expense. Indeed, one review mentions Jagex employees working a second job.

Last year I saw several salaries on the list ranging from $100-200K. The highest now is about $50K.
[/quote]
They wouldn’t have been your rank and file employee positions. Maybe management positions.[/quote]
Point being the salaries have dropped, I don’t want to work at Jagex, doesn’t matter where I’d be personally
Programmer gets paid E24K-48K, in the US at any decent workplace you’d make 2-3x that (if you’re experienced).

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex: One game wonder, and apparently an awful place to work too
